conclusion: To solve the problem, the image will be analyzed to understand the layout and flow dynamics of the containers.
The task is to predict which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.

The image shows a setup with multiple containers and baffles. Containers A, B, and C are positioned on one side, with baffles separating them. Below, there are two sets of containers labeled D and E. These containers appear to be aligned in a staggered pattern, suggesting a path for the liquid flow.
Stream A hits the blue baffle and is deflected to the left.
Stream B falls on the black baffle and is deflected to the right.
Stream C falls straight down without meeting any obstacles.

premise: Stream A hits the blue baffle and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Liquid from A flows into container D.

premise: Stream B falls on the black baffle and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Liquid from B flows into container E.

premise: Stream C falls straight down without meeting any obstacles.
conclusion: Liquid from C flows into container E.

premise: Liquid from A flows into container D; liquid from B flows into container E; liquid from C flows into container E.
conclusion: All liquid from A ends up in container D; liquid from B and C ends in container E.
